Thank you to the essential workers! #nhclassof2020’s Jonah Dzubinski finished his studies at North Hills via the Early Exit program so he could head off to boot camp but then coronavirus happened. He’s now among the essential workers of the #COVID19 pandemic working at Giant Eagle.
"He really likes his job at Giant Eagle and has been a huge help delivering groceries to his grandparents,” his mom writes.
In high school, Jonah played football all four years and volunteered in the life skills room. Jonah is scheduled to leave for boot camp at Fort Sill in Oklahoma in June. After boot camp, he will participate in artillery training.
Thank you for being among our #everydayheroes, Jonah! ❤ #nhproud #classof2020 #superheroday
💭 Do you know an essential worker who’s also a North Hills student? Message us and let us know!

Shout out to Justin Karolski who was one of our student teachers this semester and also happens to be a local EMT! North Hills High School senior Kate Wells writes, "He has been one of the best teachers during all of this. He has been the best about giving a manageable amount of work, teaching lessons as if we were still in class, and just checking in with his students to make sure we are all okay!" ❤

post_text: We love these words from our school board president, Allison Mathis North Hills School Board. Tomorrow won't be perfect for everyone and that's OKAY! We'll take it day by day and we will get through this together, North Hills! ❤ #nhproud #nhstrong #wearenorthhills
shared_text:
Allison Mathis North Hills School Board
March 31 at 11:59 AM ·

I don’t know who needs to hear this today, but I just wanted to say: you are doing a great job!

These are incredibly challenging times. We have been challenged in ways we never expected, as students, as parents, as teachers, as administrators, as global citizens, as a community, and as a school district.

And, wherever you are on your journey today, I just want you to know, you are doing a great job!

Tomorrow, we are embarking on a new phase as we start to roll out virtual learning, and parents, I will be right there with you! Please remember that this is going to be imperfect, this is not ideal, but we are going to make the best of it.

I’m so proud to be part of this community. We may be physically apart but we will get through it together.

#NHProud #NHStrong #WeAreNorthHills
